title: 107_s629
content: The Act titled "Economic Stimulus Tax Cut Act of 2001" allows for the refund of individual income and employment taxes under a new section 6428 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Economic Stimulus Tax Cut Act of 2001" provides for tax refunds to individuals based on their tax liability for the last taxable year beginning in 2000 or their applicable amount. The liability for tax is the sum of the taxpayer's regular tax liability and the tax imposed by section 55(a) for the taxable year. The "Economic Stimulus Tax Cut Act of 2001" allows for tax refunds based on the taxpayer's liability for the last taxable year. The liability includes regular tax liability, tax imposed by section 55(a), and applicable credits. The "Economic Stimulus Tax Cut Act of 2001" provides tax refunds based on taxpayer liability for the last taxable year. The applicable amounts are $600, $450, $300, and $300 for different sections and paragraphs. Taxpayers with only payroll tax liability are described in a specific paragraph. Payment under this section is deemed made on the date of enactment. The "Economic Stimulus Tax Cut Act of 2001" provides tax refunds based on taxpayer liability for the last taxable year. Payment is remitted to taxpayers within 90 days of enactment. Taxpayers who do not receive payment can claim it. Certain individuals, estates, trusts, and nonresident aliens are not eligible. The Economic Stimulus Tax Cut Act of 2001 amends Section 1324(b)(2) of title 31, United States Code, and the table of sections for subchapter B of chapter 65 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Economic Stimulus Tax Cut Act of 2001 includes a reduction in income tax rates for individuals, with amendments taking effect on the date of enactment. The Economic Stimulus Tax Cut Act of 2001 includes amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, introducing new tax rate reductions for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2000. The lowest rate bracket is set at 10 percent (12.5 percent in 2001) for taxable income not exceeding the initial bracket amount, with a 15 percent rate applying to income over this threshold. The initial bracket amounts for different subsections are $12,000 for (a), $10,000 for (b), and half of the amount for (a) for (c) and (d). The Secretary will not adjust the initial bracket amount for taxable years before January 1, 2003, in the tables under subsection (f) for years after 2001. The cost-of-living adjustment for taxable years after December 31, 2002, will be determined by substituting '2001' for '1992'. The adjustment does not apply to certain amounts and any non-multiple of $50 will be rounded down. The Secretary will adjust the tables under subsection (f) to implement this. The Secretary will adjust the tables under subsection (f) to implement changes made by the Economic Stimulus Tax Cut Act of 2001. Conforming amendments will be made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to adjust percentages and remove certain sections. Section 1(h) and Section 15 of the Code are modified, and changes are made to Section 3402(p)(2). Section 3402(p)(2) of the Revenue Code is amended to change the calculation of tax withholding on payments. The effective dates for these amendments are specified, with different dates for taxable years and withholding provisions.
